summary:
My skills and experience:
· Broad and deep technical experience in operational, exploration and development geology in different geological settings with 32 years experience, of which 15 years in deepwater exploration and appraisal and 4 years working unconventionals. 
. Worked in UK (Aberdeen NorthSea, London West of Shetlands); Netherlands; Brunei; Egypt - on and offshore; US Houston, working Nigeria and currently in The Netherlands. 
· Strong Portfolio Management skills: led the portfolio rejuvenation effort for Nigeria and analyzed and ranked all Niger Delta blocks (on and offshore) for potential commercial opportunities.
· As project, sub-surface and/or technical lead involved in several group portfolio actions in Egypt, Nigeria, Black Sea and global unconventional opportunities. 
· Shell rep in several JVs (Egypt - Rosetta with BG as operator and Edison, Tharwa – Petronas and Egyptian Government, currently TCM rep for JV with TPAO in Turkey).

. Lead on DW farm-in opportunities. Technical lead for multiple other opportunities on and offshore. 
. Contributed to the Nigeria Business Plan and Venture Plan, responsible for regional play context, portfolio and commercial strategy.', 'title': 'Regional & NBD Team Lead - Houston', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Shell International', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 1989}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2004}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}}, 'company': 'Shell International', 'description': '. . Coordinated bid-round evaluations and ranked Egypt basin potential. 
. Initiated and coordinated Regional Studies on the Paleozoic of the Western Desert, Sinai and Nile Delta Cone. Identify, evaluate and rank prospectivity in a shelf edge to deep-water environment (2nd and 3rd OAA) and propose a DW exploration strategy and program. 
. Managed multi-disciplinary evaluation on Merpati/Meragi and identified and coordinated special studies on thin-bed evaluation (including support from deepwater community in New Orleans) while issuing several well proposals (e.g. Yu, Suit). 
. Supported operations while drilling Yu with a DW drill ship.', 'title': 'Exploration Geologist/seismologist Brunei', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 1994}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 1997}}, 'company': 'Shell International', 'description': '. . Regional play evaluation of the then new Bunter down-thrown play and identified & ranked several prospects, at least one of which was proved by later drilling.', 'title': 'Exploration Geologist/seismologist Netherlands', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 1992}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 1994}}, 'company': 'Shell International', 'description': '. Work focused on evaluating blocks for license rounds in the Northern North Sea and West of Shetlands and supporting the Northern and Brent Business Units for delivering exploration wells. 
. Wrote the Brent NN well proposal, which proved an extension of the Brent Field towards Statfjord. 
. Significant contributor to the regional mapping of the West Shetland basin for the 16th Round after the Foinaven discovery. Shell led the regional evaluation with BP as partner. The team was successful in getting most of the blocks asked for.', 'title': 'Exploration Geologist/seismologist UK', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 1989}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 1992}}, 'company': 'Shell International', 'description': '. Production seismologist for the Northern Business Unit which was at the time in a big expansion phase with the development of the Cormorant Blocks, Dunlin and osprey Fields and initial drilling of Tern and Eider, with Pelican in the FDP stage. Work involved reservoir mapping on 3D and getting a consistent subsurface model together with the reservoir engineer to be able to identify fault compartments and by-passed oil and drilling locations - Cormorant Block 4 was a special challenge!', 'title': 'Production Seismologist UK', 'employment_type': None}]}]
